meanings.definition: Those who do not believe in something.
meanings.sent1: The disbelievers refused to accept the new theory.
meanings.sent2: The disbelievers in ghosts were not afraid of the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The disbelievers in aliens were shocked when a UFO landed in their backyard.
meanings.sent4: The disbelievers in climate change were like ostriches with their heads in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The disbelievers in magic were amazed when the magician made a rabbit appear out of thin air.

meanings.definition: People who reject or refuse to accept something as true.
meanings.sent1: The disbelievers questioned the authenticity of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: The disbelievers in the conspiracy theory dismissed all evidence presented to them.
meanings.sent3: The disbelievers in the fortune teller's predictions laughed when they all came true.
meanings.sent4: The disbelievers in the power of positive thinking were stuck in a cycle of negativity.
meanings.sent5: The disbelievers in the Loch Ness Monster were surprised when they saw a mysterious creature in the water.
